Sanders had raised roughly: 71 million more than Biden through early March, taking into account both money raised by the candidates’ campaigns and by outside groups supporting the candidate.
Combined: Sanders and his allied groups have raised more than $180 million, compared with $109 million for Biden and his allied groups.
Sanders has an edge in: small-dollar" donations, with about 55% of his money raised that way, compared with 36% for Biden.
The campaign: finance tracking site OpenSecrets.org provided fundraising totals reported by each candidate to the Federal Election Commission, which showed that Biden's campaign fundraising still trails Sanders' by a significant amount.
